website_summaries.verdict: Grates your cheese with ease thanks to the surface glide technology that helps prevent resistance.
pros: Solid and sturdy ergonomic handle with non-slip grip helps keep the grater steady
Elongated grooves provide a greater cutting surface
We love the detachable bottom lid, which keeps your shreds in place until you're ready
cons: Offers a small and large grating size, but could do with a medium one

customer_reviews.title: This thing is nasty dangerous
customer_reviews.text: White this thing is wicked sharp it is a danger to users. I have used box graters since I helped my grandmother grate potatoes for latkes as a child. I have used single blade graters as well. This thing adds a pound of flesh with each use. Whether grating Romano cheese on the small section or mozarella on the coarser side, this thing draws blood. I cut myself severely grating some gouda yesterday. Be aware. Beware of this kitchenware.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Glide Technology - Huh!?
customer_reviews.text: If you're expecting a grater that makes for easier, more efficient grating look elsewhere or stick with a traditional model. This thing with it's so-called glide technology is, near as I can tell, all hype. Why some product recommendation sites are recommending this grater is a mystery to me. Grating hard cheeses on this thing is markedly more difficult and far more dangerous as the flat blades tend to lock against the cheese causing greater friction and resistance such that your hand tends to buckle in towards the blades. Not good. With any hard cheese it was the same result. The curved blades of a traditional model don't cause this problem. Sent the thing back.
customer_reviews.author: Mello Char

customer_reviews.title: i do not recommend this unless you want your fingers and nails sliced each use
customer_reviews.text: this is not a good grader, the large side is good and easy to grade the down side is its so sharp that it almost always slices my finger or nail each use, then turn it to the smaller side its so dull and barely can grade much, i can only use this on cheese honestly , ones you grade your carrot it will show you how dull this is
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don’t love this grater
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grater after reading reviews suggesting it was faster and easier to grate vegetables with this than with a food processor. After using this to grate carrots, I have to say—you must be kidding!!! First, this thing will shred your fingernails. It’s virtually impossible to grate anything on it without scraping your fingernails on the blades, which really rips your nails. Second, as several other reviewers mentioned, this grater is made of very thin metal that bends when you press something against it to grate, which means you have to press really hard to grate things. Frankly, I prefer my cheap Ikea grater to this expensive unit.
customer_reviews.author: KDA

customer_reviews.title: Performs like a $30 Grater Ought to Perform
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of paying $10 for terrible graters. Took a long look at this on the Amazon site, read the reviews and took a chance. I was not disappointed. I also heeded the comments so I bought a pair of gloves to protect from cuts. I got the grater that I wanted. It works perfectly and grates the hell 'outta anything. (Note: please get some anti-cut gloves because it will grate your fingers equally well.) $30 is a ridiculous price to pay for a grater. But this pulls it off. It is not a toy and is a serious piece of kitchen cutting tools. It performs perfectly and is a necessary complement for those that take their cooking seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Montano

customer_reviews.title: Beware of poor function
customer_reviews.text: Box grater has a plastic bottom intended to catch gratings. It is very difficult to remove and cannot be done in a smooth motion. Therefore, when you remove the bottom plug after grating, the motion often results in the contents spraying all over. Quite frustrating. I called the company to see if perhaps the bottom I'd received did not fit as intended. I was told that hte grater needed to be "broken in" for 4 months or so and then the bottom plug would remove more easily. No kidding, that's what they said.
customer_reviews.author: Meg Singer Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Best box grater!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this box grater. Super duper sharp to the point where you should probably wear gloves when working with this. But it grates cheese and veggies so well, I would not want it any other way. Only taking off one star since the smaller grating side is not small enough to make parmesan cheese like dust. It creates more of a thin, small strip than a grated cheese. Works well for most applications other than having to melt parmesan in to sauces/pasta. Pretty easy to rinse off and the waves really do help glide the object you are grating with a lot of ease. I would not want another box grater after using this one. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Rush

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful
customer_reviews.text: The grater is excellent, but my god can this thing cut you. I just took pieces of skin about 1/4" x 1/2" off the tips of two of my fingers. I was dripping blood for 20 minutes. Treat this thing like a knife. If you drop it GET AWAY! Do NOT try to catch it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Exemplary Performance
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I've gone almost 7 decades (well, 5 as an adult) having only used garden-variety (haha) graters. I alway knew I disliked their cheapness and difficulty of use. I didn't know that there was an alternative. The Cuisipro is astonishingly delightful to use in every regard. Cuts easily. Makes beautiful shreds of 3 sizes (including a very nice zest). Cleans easier than any other grater design. Is well made. Don't even think any longer about it, just procure one and enjoy using it. I'm actually eager to add shredded veggies to my meals going forward!
customer_reviews.author: Bart Windrum

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, but lacking in a few options.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boxed grater because it was recommended by Sweet Home. I have a few gripes though. There is no small grater, so if you are used to grating carrots for a salad, or grating onions instead of chopping them, you will be disappointed by the size options. There is only one slicer, as shown, and I find that with the small width, it is somewhat limiting with oversized cukes or asian radishes. I love that this is dishwasher safe. However, if you use it to grate ginger on the fine micrograter, you will need to scrub it anyway. The bottom cap is a nice feature, but allows juices to run out when grating watery veggies like tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice sharp grater, but the handle...
customer_reviews.text: The handle is just about the poorest designed handle I have ever seen. There is no real attachment really, it popped off on one side, and continues to do so frequently. It snaps back into place for a little while, but seems to be attached by being wedge between the metal vertical supports, and mere friction. A nice all metal handle that was spot welded or something would have been way more preferable. Handle came off far past return date, or I would have returned it. Pretty unhappy about this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kirby A Heintzelman

customer_reviews.title: Just amazing
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually have the time to write reviews. In fact I don't have the time. But I had to do it for this grater. Yes, it's expensive, but my gosh, it's worth every cent. It's the Ferrari of graters. So sharp, so professional, so well designed and thought out. And as for the ginger grater in the bottom ... do yourself a favour and add this to your life.
customer_reviews.author: sm81

customer_reviews.title: very fine grated food product
customer_reviews.text: This high-priced and highly rated grader did not live up to its reputation. First, the grater is configured with "slits" rather than round holes as are most conventional graters. The result is a very, very fine grated food product. For example, carrots grated for a carrot salad, were so fine they did not hold up but became limp and watery. Secondly, the metal of the box grater gives under the pressure of grating. It is not as sturdy as I imagined it would be for $30+. I already donated this box grater to our local thrift store.
customer_reviews.author: Wt Mtn shopper

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: All of the microplane wedges get flattened down very quickly, now mine barely shaves anything. look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Robert s Porter

customer_reviews.title: Works beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to believe that anyone can be excited about a box grater, but I am. It just plain does what I want it to do, it feels substantial so holding it is a pleasure, and it's remarkably easy to clean. As a bonus, there's a ginger grater which I didn't realize when I bought this, but that alone would be worth the price for me. Well worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Throbble Fleep

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best box grater I've ever used! The grooves allow the food to slide smoothly and effortlessly and it's so sharp I've had no problem grating anything! I haven't had a problem cleaning it; it's awkward like all box graters, but otherwise no issues. The only thing that could make this better is if it had a protective cover for when it's not being used; I've clipped my knuckles on it a couple different times if my hand grazes it when I'm pulling other things out of the cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: TjS

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about five years and have used it mostly for grating zucchini. It can really make the chore quite easy. As mentioned in other reviews, it is very sharp, I have had no problems--I do pay attention to what I am doing. I have not experienced any problems cleaning the grater. The grated material is easily contained and removed from the grater thanks to the plastic bottom. I really think it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic grater. The build quality is amazing and this feels like it will last decades with regular use. I'm amazed at how sharp the grater is and how easily it grates. The grating size options are perfect for me - giving me enough control over how fine the gratings are. I love the removable bottom; it makes it easy to grate without making a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It is perfect exactly what I want. I was king of hesitant to order it at first due to some of the review that mentioned it is to dangerous; you can cut yourself. But I am glad I did. Either my husband or myself don't have that issue. Of course you have to be careful when you have small size of cheese. I am glad I just went and ordered it
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews I had high expectations for this grater. It appears solid and well made. Also expecting this to be very sharp, I was very careful the first time I used it. Unfortunately I received a less than sharp grater that takes forever to grate 8 Oz's of mozzarella cheese. Good news I have had no injuries.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Extreamly sharp, need to find a protective storage cover.
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a few times but, I will say that its extremely sharp. I use great caution when getting close to the blades. It seems very sound & I expect it will last years to come. I would love to find a protective cover for storing it so not to accidentally cut my fingers and for keep dust from settling on it.
customer_reviews.author: niteowl

customer_reviews.title: Best box grater, period!
customer_reviews.text: All four sides are honed to razor sharpness! As a result, grating is a breeze; only downside is you really need to invest ($9.99) in a Kevlar glove! Amazon should offer this grater with a Kevlar glove as a package deal!
customer_reviews.author: Brian E. Howard

customer_reviews.title: Great for cheese
customer_reviews.text: I've grated mostly cheese and some vegetable with this grater and it does a fantastic job. Soft and hard stuff grates nice and evenly. It's a bit annoying to wash, because it's a little cramped on the inside and if you're reckless you could start grating your sponge, but it seems to keep extremely well if I give it a little bit of extra attention. Without a dishwasher, I start with cold water before hot, and I wipe a single direction for each surface.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Great but be careful
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sharp as the wound on the side of my hand will attest. After that I bought a leather glove to put on when I use this grater. My carelessness but proceed with caution when using this (or I guess and other grater). The bottom cap is very handy. When you are done you just pull it off and pour the grated item the bowl or whatever.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Power

customer_reviews.title: watch your fingers!
customer_reviews.text: before I bought this, I saw comments about people grating their fingers. That seemed strange since aren't all graters pretty much the same? Well I'm typing this with my left hand while I try to stop the bleeding of two skinned fingers on the right. Never happened in 10 years with my old cheapo grater. I wonder if the angle of the sides is too straight down? Actually, I think it's just that the grating surfaces are razor sharp!
customer_reviews.author: Maryh

customer_reviews.title: Good performance but low value for money.
customer_reviews.text: I've grated onions, soft cheese and hard cheese. I'm not overly impressed. The performance is not significantly better than a good $10-15 box grater. It makes it hard to justify the investment. Also, the walls bend excessively, reducing and deforming the grating surface. The included base works well on ginger.
customer_reviews.author: delasoupus

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sharp and convenient
customer_reviews.text: This grater is very, very sharp! It works so much faster than my old box grater. I'm going to use the finger guide that came with my mandoline, because I don't want to "put myself" into my cooking. ;-) I love that the bottom is covered. I can grate right on the counter, and the bottom grips and contains. Then, I just remove the bottom over the bowl or pan I want the ingredients to go into. The ginger grater is very handy.
customer_reviews.author: JMom

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest grater I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This grater is Sharper than sharp. I did also purchase cut resistant gloves to wear when using this grater and I am so glad I did. And, I like that it has a removable piece on the bottom that allows one to catch and keep whatever you are grating inside the grater.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: This thing shreds
customer_reviews.text: but yeah it REALLY shreds so watch those knuckles. Seems pretty sturdy construction seems excellent. Time will. Worth the money if you make a lot of hash browns
customer_reviews.author: peter w middleton

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: $28 for a cheese grater? Must be one heck of a cheese grater. Well guess what it is. This thing is a pleasure to use for cheese, ginger, nutmeg, you name it. The fact that the cutting edges are etched rather than stamped makes all the difference. You can grate a ton of cheese in no time smoothly and with little effort. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: The Ferrari of graters!
customer_reviews.text: I'd thought about buying one of these for a few years, but the price put me off. And it is pricey--but well worth the cost! People who have them call theirs the Ferrari of graters--and I see what they mean! Very sharp--wtch your fingers. I use a metal glove to avoid cutting myself. Cheese does not stick to it. Fast grating. Even after grating cheese, all it takes is a rinse, unlike cheap graters. Wish I had purchased one of these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: A. Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Best grater I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great grater. Super sharp and does everything from zesting citrus to grating mozzarella for pizza. Only downside is it's a little tricky to clean, but that can't really be avoided in this kind of product. It's meant to tear things up, so it also wants to tear up anything you use to clean it with. I just clean it right after use by lightly brushing with a scouring pad and rinsing.
customer_reviews.author: aglowucannotsee

customer_reviews.title: Simplify the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I like the multiple users of this one, simple combo grater. The handle feels just right and helps keep the whole experience, well, solid. The product ends up exactly where you want it, either corralled inside the grater, or, onto a surface. Cleaning is easy.
customer_reviews.author: bevWr

customer_reviews.title: It’s an amazing manual food processor
customer_reviews.text: This is so much more than a box grater...it’s sharpness makes food processor activities possible, super fast. I use the single cut side all the time for thin slicing vegetables rather than a knife. It’s basically a non-adjustable mandolin.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp
customer_reviews.text: This grater is easy to use but be very careful because it is extremely sharp. That being said, it works great and is easier to use than the grater attachment for my kitchen aide and does a more efficient job and is easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: judy h.

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous! Be Careful!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been grating cheese for basically my whole life (since I first was forced to do the chore to help my mother in the kitchen, so probably 40 years) without ever really having much of an accident. I have owned this grater for 3 months now and twice it has shaved off the side of my thumb. Seriously, it is that sharp! It works as well as any other grater, but I feel like the danger aspect is enough that I would never buy it again. In fact, I went to the store and bought a new one today (after my accident last night) and this bad boy is now on its way to the goodwill.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Grant

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing tool to have in the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing tool to have in the kitchen. I use it almost daily to grate Parmesean cheese and to use the tiny mandoline slicer on the side for garlic, cucumbers or radishes! I have been through at least 5 cheese graters that fell apart or took too much effort to use. This box grater with crazy sharp openings, gives you the choice between fine or coarse shreds. The "lid" on the bottom means I don't need to dirty a plate to grate cheese. Love, love, love. I literally recommend this grater to anyone who watches me cook.
customer_reviews.author: KMK

customer_reviews.title: Great cheese grater
customer_reviews.text: Solid design and construction. I researched these things for a longer than anyone should and this one blew people away because of the cutting power, ease of cleaning and strength this thing has. It holds up to everything I read up on it too. Great cheese grater.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and makes quick work of cheeses and vegetables
customer_reviews.text: My wife needed a grater so I bought this one. She was delighted by how versatile, lightweight and easy to use it is. This is a serious grater it will get in there and get the job done- quickly. Pretty easy to clean as well. She says there’s no greater grater on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I like this grater
customer_reviews.text: It's like a micro planer and box grater got married. I live the largest side the best, but the smaller sides are okay, as long as your product isn't too "tough".. Like ginger, it doesn't grate well. It functions well anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Battousai

customer_reviews.title: DOn't like the cover on the bottom
customer_reviews.text: Other than my headline I like it a lot. I don't use the cover on the bottom at all after trying it once. It is sturdy and very sharp. Should last for years!
customer_reviews.author: mtsfly

customer_reviews.title: Sharp is good.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived yesterday, so only a test run. Seems sturdy, size is nice, the bottom cover fits well. Cleaned easily. As many people have said, this grater is sharp. It is a kitchen tool, like a knife, why would you not want it to be sharp?
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this grater is top quality and I highly recommend it. I wish there were a scaled-down version, as my cooking for one or two people doesn't require as much surface area as this provides. I soak it as soon as I'm done using it, and a brush cleans it easily. It's sturdy, sharp, and efficient. The vintage pyramid box grater style is time-tested and grandmother-approved.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Best grater ever - especially for hard cheeses!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owed a lot of graters over my long life but this one proved to be the most efficient at grating hard cheese. It’s so easy and satisfying to use.
customer_reviews.author: Trade Wind

customer_reviews.title: Best Grater
customer_reviews.text: This grater is super sharp and makes the work so easy. I have put in the dishwasher and it is fine. Does NOT rust. Very sturdy. Not cheap or flimsy. I have had this for a few months now and use it all the time. I think this will last for years and years.
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised, quality product
customer_reviews.text: Slicing cheese is easier using this grater, the surface glide technology just works. It is a step up from all of the other graters I have used. I will buy an additional one if Cuisipro makes a larger version.
customer_reviews.author: kevin mcbrien

customer_reviews.title: Well made and useful
customer_reviews.text: I like that it has multiple grates for everything from finely zesting to more coarsely shredding. It's well built and I expect it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great grater, greatest!
customer_reviews.text: Simple, modern, clean design with a couple of plusses. The snap-off bottom holds the grated material inside and the extra ginger root grater was a nice surprise. The edges are very sharp and the thickness of the metal construction means a longer life with more uniform grating/slicing sizes. The handle is comfortable and gives a secure grip. The grating surfaces are slick so less effort is required. I recommend wearing hand protection while using as the edges are truly sharp!
customer_reviews.author: ScreenFont

customer_reviews.title: Just what I'd hoped for.
customer_reviews.text: I like the material used for the handle. It assures a confident grip for stable use. Cutting surfaces are very sharp and effective. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Cisco

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and useful
customer_reviews.text: This is what Wiercutter said was the best. I bought it and I really like it. When you use it there is a cover on the bottom so all your lemon peels are neatly kept inside till you finish.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Great, versatile tool
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had replaced my cheese grater sooner. This does so much more than grate cheese and is very effective (and sharp!) No need to have a separate microplane zester as the zester side works very well. I also like the bottom cap feature to hold onto the contents of what you've shredded, although wish it had a better handgrip to pry it apart.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Such a huge improvement over our old box grater. Super sharp, and the ridges in the metal definitely help make the grating easier. Be careful where you store it, I cut my hand reaching past it for my measuring cups!
customer_reviews.author: Susan D.

customer_reviews.title: Warning! SHARP!
customer_reviews.text: This is the sharpest grater I've ever used, you will lose skin if you aren't careful. It makes short work of a block of cheese.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great grater but....
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grater but beware it is sharp. Good build quality. Was not paying attention as I should have been :). Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Coffeedawgs

customer_reviews.title: I love this
customer_reviews.text: I understand why this is a Cook's Illustrated Recommended product. I replaced an inexpensive box grater with this unit and I'm very happy I did. For example grating Parmigiano-Reggiano was once a burden and created a big mess, not any more. The extreme sharpness of the grating surface makes it very easy; and very little of the cheese winds up on the cutting board outside of the grater.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Sir Shred Allot ... :)
customer_reviews.text: The best I’ve ever had works great very sharp does it’s job fits snugly in my cupboard
customer_reviews.author: Dottie-Ruffles

customer_reviews.title: BEST GRATER EVER
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best box for your I’ve ever used! So easy to grate, requires no muscle, metal doesn’t flex and the grates are so sharp that everything comes out extremely late and snowy in a way I didn’t know was possible.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and SHARP
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Be careful though - these are sharp as hell! Recommend buying a non-cut glove to protect your fingers!
customer_reviews.author: Michael H

customer_reviews.title: SHARP
customer_reviews.text: Sharp! Watch your fingers. I think everyone in the family has cut their fingers on the grater. That said, it really grates cheese well. And the single blade on the side is great for Cucumbers. A bit hard to clean because it can shred sponges or scrub brush bristles. Just be careful!
customer_reviews.author: kelli cree

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. I just wish the product had a full area for slicing.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K Lee

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Box Grater, sturdy and high quality product. I've had many handheld box graters over the years and this one is the best by far. I'm so glad I bought two of them. Well, worth the purchase, may buy another for our cabin.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Pea :)

customer_reviews.title: This is a super sharp and high performing tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a super sharp and high performing tool. So glad I have it. I find it's best used with no-cut gloves because of the sharpness of the blades, but it works like a charm on all things that need grating or shredding.
customer_reviews.author: KLB

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST COMMERCIAL GRATER ON THE PLANET
customer_reviews.text: It's sharp, so be careful! However, that's what makes it so easy to use. It's versatile and precise. Don't even try another one!
customer_reviews.author: sasha B

customer_reviews.title: The Gratest
customer_reviews.text: Sharpest Cheese grater I've ever used. Dangerously sharp if you don't keep your eyes on what you're doing. Has a firm & strong grip. Large open interior so that a whole hand can fit within during cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: HanShotFirst

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing grater and super sharp (so be careful!). I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best grater made!
customer_reviews.text: Original model had a plastic handle that deteriorated after about 6 years.....probably should have not put it in the dishwasher. This new version, as razor sharp as the older model, has a metal handle and I am handwashing it. Best grater made!
customer_reviews.author: Charles G. Braden Jr.

customer_reviews.title: slightly scary
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp. Make use of included ginger grater. Grate ginger, not finger.
customer_reviews.author: Rain

customer_reviews.title: Caution - Sharpest Tool
customer_reviews.text: So sharp! Be careful when washing not to slice yourself. Grates well. Bottom is a perfect addition.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: A well made product. It cost more but worth the money. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice and stable
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sharp but doesn’t seem especially different from my old brand.
customer_reviews.author: Susie cute

customer_reviews.title: Sharp
customer_reviews.text: It does cost twice as much as some other graters but will last a lifetime. Never rust and sharp. It's a sad state when everything we buy is assessed by price. Quality is good for the soul.
customer_reviews.author: Zoltan Vlad

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, sharp, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: i have used this a few times for grating a block of cheddar and zucchini. It has worked great! VERY sharp, so watch those fingers as you get closer to the blades. Easy to clean. I like how there's a cap on the bottom, so i don't have to grate over a bowl or anything. I just grate away, then take the cap off and let it fall into the bowl. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: KFM

customer_reviews.title: Mehh
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what all the fuss is about this product. Yes, it’s sharp, but it’s a grater. Maybe it will hold the edge better over time?
customer_reviews.author: marla

customer_reviews.title: Best box grater I have used
customer_reviews.text: Best box grater I have used. The bottom 'lid' allows shredding of cheese without it getting everywhere. The variety of grating surfaces is a plus, and the holes are super sharp. As good as any microplane brand I have used, but in a box-grater format.
customer_reviews.author: JMDog

customer_reviews.title: Cheese Grater
customer_reviews.text: I have gone through many cheese graters in search of one that meets my expectations of ease of use and functionality. The Cuisipro box grater is the best I have come across to date. It grates hard and soft cheeses exceptionally well and quickly with easy cleanup, especially in a dishwasher. The device is sturdy and ergonomically practical.
customer_reviews.author: William A. DePalo

customer_reviews.title: An excellent grater
customer_reviews.text: I've had a lot of graters and this one works the best. It's well-constructed and has a bottom catcher, so you won't make a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Fox

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and works well.
customer_reviews.text: This is very sharp. It slices right through hard and soft cheeses as well as vegetables like carrots. It is a little scary how sharp the blades are, but that is what makes it work so well.
customer_reviews.author: Some NW guy

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, and well-built
customer_reviews.text: Sharp. And has a fine enough side for zesting, just like a microplane. I love it so far, and with metal rivets bearing the structural weight it ought to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Rembrandt Q. Einstein

customer_reviews.title: I have hunted all over for a good quality cheese grater
customer_reviews.text: I have hunted all over for a good quality cheese grater. This one fits the bill. It is sharp, versatile and just the right size.
customer_reviews.author: savvy grandma

customer_reviews.title: Simple quality product
customer_reviews.text: If you want a box grater imo this is the best you can buy. Solid one-piece construction and has a no-stick surface texture that prevents buildup and improves grating/slicing. I prefer this over the microplanes I have, it's very sharp so be careful.
customer_reviews.author: mkasz01

customer_reviews.title: I thought Microplane was the best...I have converted to Cuisipro!!
customer_reviews.text: After several short term stints with Microplane box graters (plastic parts all broke with 2-3 months of almost daily use), I looked at this and almost didn't believe all the reviews - but I am glad I bought this. I have had this for several months, and as someone who cooks at home 5-6 nights per week, I can say that this cuts hard cheese (Parmesan) as easily as it does Mozzerella, which was a difficult task with the Microplane. The slicer works great too, from yams to potatoes to carrots and more.
customer_reviews.author: mrowl

customer_reviews.title: Worth if
customer_reviews.text: Grates so easily, smooth and quick. Mozzarella disappeared, cheddar disappeared. We even have zested lemons super easily! Didn’t give it a 5 star cuz cleaning can be hard if you don’t rinse it immediately. 4.5 stars
customer_reviews.author: A.L

customer_reviews.title: Great grater.  Stainless!
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. No rust so far. The wife loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Nils Brahe

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and works like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is solid as a rock and works exactly as you'd expect. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wegner

customer_reviews.title: Great for cheese, but doesn't differentiate fingers, so be careful.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I've only really used this for cheese so far, but it does that really well. And fingers, I've grated my fingers on it, it does those really well too.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy and easy to use. The bottom cover makes it convenient and keep my counters tidy.
customer_reviews.author: Eve Curtis

customer_reviews.title: This is the grater you're looking for.
customer_reviews.text: High quality, sharp blades. The sides do help things slide a little easier, too.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisFree

customer_reviews.title: Small bore side great for zesting grating garlic
customer_reviews.text: It’s great but got for grating garlic and zesting very effective for those purposes but hard to clean
customer_reviews.author: Galeliza

customer_reviews.title: Best box grater !!
customer_reviews.text: This box grater may seem expensive but it is the last one you will ever purchase . Beware as it is very sharp !
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Great box grater
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this grater after reading the reviews on Cooks Illustrated website. It is very sharp so be careful when grating. Works great. It has a rubber bottom so won't slip on the countertop and also a ginger grater/base.
customer_reviews.author: shoppingismybag

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean; easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean, nice cap on bottom to contain grated product.
customer_reviews.author: Fl. Granny

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on reviews, and my previous cheap grater was so much better. This thing can barely shred cheddar cheese (and the shreds look awful). Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sfreviewer

customer_reviews.title: a nice added bonus
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp cutting blades. The bottom cap makes shredding less messy and there are measuring lines on the outside that let you know approximately how much has been shredded. The ginger grater on the bottom cap is convenient and works well too, a nice added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: nice to have various shredding sizes
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp, nice to have various shredding sizes. I don't care for the shredding holes going all the way down to the bottom. It makes it very hard to get a clean cut on the bulkier things. Help to elevate the grater on a box or coffee cup.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a box shredder. I've had this for 18 months know. Still works just like new.
customer_reviews.author: John Grotjohn

customer_reviews.title: This one is the best..
customer_reviews.text: I have used several over the years. This one is the best....throw it in the dishwasher and comes out sparkling! Sharp blades and works like a charm!!!
customer_reviews.author: pollyanna

customer_reviews.title: Best grater I have used
customer_reviews.text: Works great - clean up is super easy....things don't stick
customer_reviews.author: Mark A McFarlane

customer_reviews.title: Not just for cheese.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, use I tr for potatoes and onions for hash browns.
customer_reviews.author: Queen_Boudicca

customer_reviews.title: Great Grater.
customer_reviews.text: Thank you, Wirecutter! This grater is super satisfying to use and doesn't leave you with food stuck everywhere. That being said, my boyfriend managed to do a number on his thumb while trying to make hash browns one morning, so use with caution.
customer_reviews.author: EC

customer_reviews.title: Great grater for vegetable and cheese
customer_reviews.text: Overall the grater is fantastic. It works very well for both vegetables and cheese. It also seems to clean well in the dishwasher. The only problem is that the bottom piece sticks VERY securely which makes it difficult to remove.
customer_reviews.author: William Lee

product_meta.title: Cuisipro Surface Glide Technology 4-Sided Boxed Grater
product_meta.description:
Color:Stainless Steel

 WHY CHOOSE THE CUISIPRO SURFACE GLIDE TECHNOLOGY GRATERS?
COMPETITION
There are an abundance of stamped and etched graters available in the market, but not all graters are created equal. Only Cuisipro's graters take etched graters to the next level with a special Surface Glide Technology, exclusive to Cuisipro. 

In addition to razor sharp etched blades the Surface Glide Technology creates the perfect balance between ease of grating and maximum efficiency for the ultimate grating experience that etched graters alone cannot compete with. 

In addition to the exclusive Cuisipro Surface Glide Technology, the entire line of Cuisipro graters and shavers possess well-applied ergonomics.

FEATURES
GRATE MORE WITH LESS EFFORT WITH SURFACE GLIDE TECHNOLOGY:
The science behind Super Glide Technology is based in the repeated grooved pattern that is spread evenly across the face of the grating surface. The grooves provide 2 distinct benefits beyond other graters. First, the groove reduces resistance, making grating effortless. Secondly the groove elongates the length of each individual blade, so it has a larger cutting surface that comes in contact with food, therefore producing more gratings per stroke. Combined these features to create a perfect surface for outstanding uninterrupted grating performance where food glides through blades.

PROTECTIVE COVER DOUBLES AS A MEASURING TOOL: 
The Rasps and Flat grater collection feature a snap on, clear protective cover with US and metric measurements. Not only does the cover provide safe storage, but is a container to catch grated ingredients for measuring.

Very few graters offer protective covers and no other grater in the market provides a cover with the added benefit of measuring or catching the grated ingredient.

SECURE GRIP FOR SAFETY: 
The entire line of graters feature ergonomic handles with non-slip finish designed to protect your hands while providing the best grip possible for safe grating. Similar rasps graters don't have handles and other graters don't have the same attention to non-slip grip and ergonomic handles. 

NON SLIP END FOR STABILITY: 
The Rasps, Flat and Dual graters have non�slip ends and box grater a non-slip base that keep the graters in place and steady while resting on the cutting board. No chance of grater slipping or sliding around the surface.

Majority of graters do not include non-slip ends � especially for rasps and dual graters.

All Cuisipro products are backed by a 25 year warranty.
feature_bullets: Features exclusive Surface Glide Technology: a grooved grating surface that allows you to grate more with less effort
Grooves reduce resistance, making it easier to grate food
Grooves also elongate the length of each individual blade; more food is grated with each stroke
Non-slip handle and base provide stability; grater can easily handle large quantities of food.
Bonus ginger grater base shreds fresh ginger root while leaving unwanted fibers behind
Fine for citrus zest and parmesan, coarse for cheeses and vegetables, ultra-coarse for soft cheeses, and slicer for a variety of vegetables
Non-slip handle and removable base for added stability
Stainless steel blade, hand washing preferred
